pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:1.21.1: Pavārita is often translated as “invited”, but the word also means “satisfied”. In the present case, the contextual meaning (see below) is that the monk has expressed his satisfaction after being invited to take more, thus “refused an invitation to eat more”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.10: Akappiyakataṁ hoti, lit. “It is done with what is unallowable.” The “it”, both here and below, refers to the ceremony of making it allowable, and the “what” refers to the food.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc35:3.1.12: Anuccāritakataṁ hoti, lit. “It is not done lifted.” The point seems to be that one has to hold the food in hand.
